Package model

Class Simulation

java.lang.Object
model.Engine
model.Simulation
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Simulation extends Engine implements Runnable
The Simulation class represents a queueing system simulation. It simulates a scenario with a specified number of service points (e.g., cashier desks) and customers arriving and being served. The service times and interarrival times are based on specified probability distributions. The simulation runs until a predefined number of customers are served, and calculates metrics like average waiting time. This class extends the Engine class and implements Runnable for execution in a thread.

  • Constructor Details

    • Simulation

      public Simulation(Controller controller, int servicePointsCount, Simulation.Distributions dist, double meanSP, double varianceSP, double meanAP, double varianceAP)
      Constructs a Simulation instance. Initializes the service points and the arrival process based on specified distributions.
      Parameters:
      controller - The controller for the application, used for logging and updating UI.
      servicePointsCount - The number of service points (e.g., cashier desks) to simulate.
      dist - The type of probability distribution for service and arrival processes.
      meanSP - The mean for the service point distribution.
      varianceSP - The variance for the service point distribution.
      meanAP - The mean for the arrival process distribution.
      varianceAP - The variance for the arrival process distribution.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      protected void initialize()
      Initializes the simulation by generating the first arrival event.
      Specified by:
      initialize in class Engine

    • runEvent

      protected void runEvent(Event e)
      Processes a single event in the simulation. Depending on the event type (ARR for arrival, DEP for departure), it handles customer arrivals and departures.
      Specified by:
      runEvent in class Engine
      Parameters:
      e - The event to be processed in the simulation.

    • tryCEvents

      protected void tryCEvents()
      Tries conditional events (C-events) in the simulation. This method checks each service point and starts service if a service point is ready and there is a customer in the queue.
      Specified by:
      tryCEvents in class Engine

    • getCustomersServed

      public int getCustomersServed()
      Gets the total number of customers served during the simulation.
      Returns:
      The number of customers served.

    • end

      public void end()
      Ends the simulation, saves the results to a database, and logs the outcome. If the saving process fails, an error message is logged.
      Specified by:
      end in class Engine
